item.title: Street sign overhangs our property and street lamp insoles to close to the walking. Please move the street lamp to original place., 7th October
item.description:
1. Street sign overhangs our property - we do not give permission to that 2. ⁠street lamp installed to close to the walling, preventing future maintenance of the wall Please urgently move ⁠the lamp to appropriate place further away from our boundary so that it does not overhang our property. We have asked the builder installing it and were advised that not possible, as moving only the sign itself is not possible and unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldermary Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped various items left in street and side alley, 7th October
item.description:
Vans are being seen on my neighbours CCTV dumping rubbish and furniture etc on the street and down the side alley between 1a Spencer Road and Corner of London Road. The neighbour at 15 Kingsmead Court which is the corner house on London Road/Soencer Road has the CCTV footage. I have removed the smaller bags of rubbish to bins but the large items still remain. Residents of Kingsmead Court do not have direct access to the alleyway the gates are locked shut for security. Please can the items be removed and the CCTV reviewed, the neighbour said she will also make a report online to you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spencer Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Acacia tree outside no 5. Shoots path lifting leaves, 7th October
item.description:
Acacia tree recently had dead wood removed but not the Shoots coming out of base of tree lifting path which is blocking access. Weeds are growing wild. Leaves from the tree due to their excess of fall are causing problems to my property no 5 Acacia Close. The gutters and drains both back and front getting blocked plus causing rain water to overflow from the gutters. We are overrun by these leaves and we are finding it very difficult to keep them under control. They get into my property everywhere. Bedrooms bathrooms kitchens etc. As we are both in our latter years it has all become quite unbearable and is making our lives a misery. My husband is registered disabled and I am now having medical issues myself. Therefore we feel that this tree should be trimmed down due to its excessive leaf drop onto my property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Acacia Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
